intro: Willoughbya oxylepis, commonly known as the African star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant has strap-shaped, evergreen leaves that are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardeners in temperate climates. Willoughbya oxylepis is also noted for its ability to produce a unique, fragrant scent during flowering.
